Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: IMNRG
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews that this hotel is in a great location and breakfast was accompanied with the reservation, but that is about it. The hotel room, itself, was essentially IN the stairwell, the walls were so thin you heard EVERYTHING while people were going up and down the stairs, overall a horrible experience. Thankfully, I was there for all of about 12 hours as I was traveling home the next day, but I would recommend that you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient price and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Sirbu G
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to discover how friendly and helpful the staff was...I would like to say thanks to everybody there, they helped me a lot with all the information i needed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - All things considered”
Reviews.Author: Janelle C
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that the staff were extremely nice and helpful and the location is great. I give this hotel the full rating because of the price, the staff and the location. There are a lot of things that i could complain about however i feel it was a great deal and i would definitely look to go back there if i had to visit Amsterdam again. I'll list a few things that may contradict my rating, but i will stick to the rating at any cost. The walls are rather thin, you can hear the people next door having a conversation if they are a bit too loud, we were lucky there was only 1 such conversation in 5 days. Breakfast is rather limited, but there is something for everyone (one reviewer has listed all the breakfast items so i will not repeat). They have cats in the lobby which join for breakfast - but then again this is common practice in Amsterdam - they may serve a purpose. With all that said & i know i am repeating myself now - I would go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Review of stay at the Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Fiona R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i organised a party of 14 mixed group of both couples and single people. The hotel was in a fabulous location, clean and comfortable for everyone. Breakfast was continental and with a good selection that everyone could get as much or as little as they liked. The staff were chatty, very friendly and extremely helpful.. We arrived early before the 3pm check in but were allowed into one room that was available to drop off luggage so that we did not have to carry around with us all day. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The only negative feedback maybe is that one of the rooms did not have running hot water but as were a large group we were able to share the showers betwen us. (Individually of course). Definately would book to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: T. B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A friendly and helpfull staff and a good atmosphere. The beds were a bit too narrow and they really need to buy one more toaster to awoid traficjam in the breakfastroom. But besides that we were really satisfied with this hotel and found it good for the price

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations of a Hotel Snob”
Reviews.Author: sarahbaker2702
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel two weeks ago, having left it too late to have much choice of hotels. I am a massive snob when it comes to hotel, and was extremely worried having read reviews of what it was going to be like. We were four 22 year old girls travelling both to see the city and visit the museums, and go out at night to the bars and clubs. The location of the hotel was perfect - Leidesplein is near and that was where we enjoyed the most. Rembrandt Square was a bit cheesier with some not so nice bars. The shops and cafes around are really great to wander around and Dam Square is not far. The rooms are small - we were in a four person room, which consisted of two single beds and a bunk bed. The bunk bed didnt have a ladder up but it was just quite comical more than anything. The room was small, there wasnt really room to do much but we just sat on the beds to get ready. There wasnt much of a wardrobe, a rail and a couple of drawers but we were only there four days and so kept everything in our cases. The bathroom was small too but clean - it smelled a bit damp at times due to the lack of a window but it had been cleaned well which was the most important thing for me. The beds were comfy and clean (I checked very closely as soon as arriving!) and although the carpet and curtains was a bit old and grubby it wasnt anywhere near as bad as I thought it might be for the price. All in all, its a small hotel with small rooms, and could do with a bit of a tidy up, but its clean for the most part, the staff are friendly (might come off a bit sarcastic) and willing to help you with places to go. Didnt make breakfast any of the days but it looked ok, if basic. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: quinnbag84
Reviews.Content: me & my 2 friends stayed here for one night and thank god it was only one night. check in isnt til 3pm,and even at 3 we were waiting to check in for an hour. no secure storage for bags. our room looked cosy until we saw the beds. stains all over the pillows sheets etc. and to make it more interesting we found the graveyard of insects over the walls and ceilings. eating a live by insects at night was an experience too. But one good thing was the location. tram stop just around the corner.plenty of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SpachNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as a solo traveller. The location was good; very close to a tram stop (Keizersgracht; trams 1,2,5) from Central Station and within walking distance of nice restaurants and the central area. The shower was very good :-). The breakfast was adequate, with cheese, cold meet, bread, boiled eggs, jams, museli and fruit salad. The price was reasonable for Amsterdam. The staff were often not at the front desk and there seemed to be no bell to ring for them. The room I stayed in was in the lower level and very small; there wasn't really anywhere to store my case and I had to step over it to get around the room (just as well I had a small case!). The hotel was clean, but is looking tired and in need of a refurbishment. Free wifi is available.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a good price with a great location”
Reviews.Author: jamesik
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a great location, takes few minutes by tram to get to the Dam square or not more than 10 minutes to walk there. The staff was friendly, even though we had some credit card issues it was handled ok. Rooms are not big which is expected when you look at the most houses in Amsterdam. But it was clean, bathroom was recently renovated, no issues with TV or showe (didnt turn on the AC). New towels every day. Breakfast was ok, toust with cheese and ham, marmelade, honey and peanut butter along with coffee and tea. I was quite surprised after reading bad reviews here. Overall ranking is as the title says - good choice for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill Recently”
Reviews.Author: PeterWWW
Reviews.Content: Downtown Hotel is situated close to Leidseplein and on 3 main tram routes from the Centraal Station. A very good location. I have stayed maybe 15 times over the past five years and I have seen the place go steadily downhill in that time. It used to be a basic, clean and comfortable hotel but nowadays is very tired looking and in need of refurbishment. On my last stay the first room I was given had no hot water, the second room I was given had no functioning room safe - it was broken and the third room I was given had an awful smell. By this time I had given up and just accepted the room. I only stayed two nights and was out most of the time so the smell wasn't a massive issue. The carpets in the hallways are starting to look threadbare and the hotel is in need of a good spruce up. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast is adequate, the coffee being absolutely outstanding. I am sad this hotel has gone downhill as I used to enjoy staying there as it was so convenient. I shall now have to find another hotel in Amsterdam close to all the local attractions. Once it has been tidied and brought up to date I will stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great staff!”
Reviews.Author: fcb4life
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, the markets,shopping streets and clubs are very close. The rooms were pretty small, but we already expected that the rooms would be small. The rooms were clean but the safe didnt function. We asked the staff and they fixed this problem. Furthermore the staff was very friendly and they provided us with any information we asked for. The breakfast was simply but fine, there was brown and white bread, boiled eggs, cheese, 2 different meat toppings, 3 different jams, peanutbutter, serials and fruit salad. Coffee and tea was free during the breakfast. The only downside was that they didnt have orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Simon99Crewe
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is an expensive city, so this hotel is good value in that context. The room was very small but functional - I was in the basement, my friend was on the top floor. Both had a comfortable bed and were clean. The en-suite bathroom was also small but modern and clean too. Continental breakfast was included and was simple but fine. Being close to Leidseplein, this hotel was in a great location. If you expect luxury from a hotel like this you'll be disappointed, but if you're realistic it's just what you need for a couple of nights in Amsterdam without spending too much on accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: yugobetrugo
Reviews.Content: Location is as good as it can get in my opinion. Its between rembrandtplein and leidsplein very good restorants are near. Staff was very nice. There was a turkish guy and a german girl both were really helpfull also comming home late was not a problem. The rooms are tiny and small but yeah thats how most of the old buildings in amsterdam are. I imagine it can be hard for elder people to go upstaits since there is no elevators. For young people with small budget I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “so helpful, good location in v pretty street”
Reviews.Author: hlittle3
Reviews.Content: Booked the wrong dates, turned up a day late and they had charged for the 2 nights we were staying. The guy at reception did all he could to help us tho, he managed to get us in for that night; though we were split up, he heavily discounted the rooms which we were so thankful for. He then booked us into another hotel up the road for the next night and arranged to have our cars dropped back off at the new hotel. My room was cold when we got back as I hadn't turned the radiator on before I went out ... didn't really think i'd have to do that..! breakfast was fine but she packed up before it was supposed to finish at 930 which meant a couple of my friends missed out on breakfast. Perfectly fine hotel though, and it's worth what you will pay.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: jumbone_10
Reviews.Content: terrible wouldnt recomend any one stay here the rooms are unclean the showers didnt work and the breakfast is terrible the toaster takes forever , the only nice thing about the hotel is the cats

Reviews.Title: “The only good point is location”
Reviews.Author: Begemoth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The only good point of this hotel is it's location, 10 minutes walking to the city centre. I didn't use any services except wireless internet but had some problems with connection and coverage. The breakfast was auful, absolutely uneadible. Moreover these were several cats in the canteen, it means that there is no point to say anything about cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “DonÂ´t stay...bad investment”
Reviews.Author: rafawais
Reviews.Content: despite off good location this hotel is terrible: not hot water in the bathrooms for two days (outside weather was 5Â°C) and 48hours to solve this...no support to go to another hotel/place to take a shower and no compensation/discount for this. unfortunatelly there werenÂ´t avaliable hotels so close there if there were obviously I had changed. Noise all night long for the others rooms...walls like papers no smoking hotel...joke...probably the sprinklers are decoration employees with good intentions but just started in the job and not trained enough to support the guests with the problems... not recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: CarlosNovais
Reviews.Content: Positive: The hotel is in a very central street in the ring of canals. Quickly reaches the Museum Square, the Liedsplein and Red Light. Negative: The rooms are small and the bed linen has become very dirty, with stains ... The elevator did not work. Charged a fee of 3% we pay by credit card, since we took no cash. The breakfast was sparse. Do not come back, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but sketchy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadian_dutchy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July, I met a few friends who were staying at a local hostel. Alarm bells went off for me when I said I would be paying by credit card and the man at the front desk told me there would be a 30 percent fee ontop of my price if I paid by credit card. I did have cash on my so I payed with cash, but everyone I have talked to since says this is a scam and they cannot take on extra charges for using a credit card. Just wanted to let everyone know before they decide to stay at this location.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location, not bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcase23
Reviews.Content: The location was what made this hotel worth it. It was really ideal in that sense. Service was friendly, but not very experienced. They couldn't get the key machine to work, so we never got a key to our room. Whoever was at the desk had to walk with us to our room to open the door, but they seemed happy to do it. The room was in the basement, but still had a window (it looked onto a gap in the building and directly faced another room, but it was still nice to have some light). Nice tv, tiny but very clean and nice bathroom. Not much ambiance in the room, but the beds were comfortable and everything was very clean. Breakfast was fine, but eating out is much better! Overall, it was worth it to pay for the location. We were disappointed with the room at first, but it met our needs and it's become a bit of a joke. Glad we stayed there though. Amsterdam is a very young, lively city, so you don't really want to be spending much time in the room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “better than ok!”
Reviews.Author: daphne85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Downtown hotel during a holiday in the end of 2008. As many have mentioned, the location is what makes up for a lot of shortcomings. The room was nice - a bit small, but they all are in Amsterdam. Unsuite bathroom was great, spacious and clean. No storage in the room - just a corner with a few hangers, but since we only stayed for a couple of days, that really wasn't that big of a deal. Breakfast was ok, a bit dissapointing as the choice was very limited and it was oh so crowded! The girl at breakfast room must have been the most miserable person i have ever seen - not even a hint of smile passed her lips.... The wireless internet worked best in the breakfast room, and since the signal was almost non-existent in our room, we used to sneak down there for an hour or so in the afternoons. The only really annoying thing is that they do not allow to bring your own food inside the hotel. It went as far as hiding a bottle of water in the bag to be able to have a sip before sleep. But overall it was good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location is main plus point”
Reviews.Author: Tomtastic
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us travelled to Amsterdam for the Ester weekend. Hotels were very expensive and we ended up going for this 'hotel', as a 4 person room. To be honest it's more like a hostel, our room was small, one single bed, one set of bunk beds, and a squeeky camp-bed-style bed. However it's safe, clean and an excellent location. The included breakfast was a bit of a joke - only hot option was toast, which you had to que for 10 mins to make your self. Then some spreads/jams, cheese slices and some dodgy meat slices. Ac ouple fo cereal options and milk Also Machine-made instant coffee and some water-down drinks. However, back to the main plus. The location is fantastic really. A good location for all the sights, but away from the more seedy centre, where the British tourist hordes are and the theme bars etc. Close to the hotel was a good selection of very nice cafes, bars and restaurants. One thing to watch out for is the 5% local tax charge, which I hadn't seen in the small print of my booking and had to stump up for when I paid on arrival. Staff were variable, some grumpy, some smiley. Oh and there are two cats that prowl around! Very nice (if you like cats) and in fact many local cafes and bars have their own resident cat! While it seemed pricey (Â£140 p/night for a very small 4 person room) it was the best we could find for the time of year and, with location the most important factor, it suited us well.

Reviews.Title: “ok....”
Reviews.Author: 7candles
Reviews.Content: The best thing about hotel was that the location is great near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Youth hostel standard accommodation, for triple the price!”
Reviews.Author: emma134
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the equivalent of more than Â£100 a night, for this we got a bed each and an ensuite toilet and shower. The duvet covers were stained. There was no wardrobe or drawers and so had to leave all our clothes in the suitcase. The shower was good and the toilet flushed OK. Our room was on the third floor which required climbing four ladder like staircases (though this is common for amsterdam houses). There was a lift but could only fit one person in at a time. The staff were less than friendly when we arrived early but they did let us leave our suitcase there. Check in was not allowed until 3pm. Breakfast was bread, plastic cheese and plastic meat, cereal and marmalade. There was a fuit salad but the individual fruits were unidentifiable and smelled and tasted like feet so we avoided it.

Reviews.Title: “find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: cait24
Reviews.Content: amsterdam is lovley and we will definatly be returning, we will not however be going back to this hotel. lacationwise its ideal, that is the only positive thing there is to say. everytime we entered our room we were met with the vile stench of sewerage, coming from the disgusting bathroom. the rooms were filthy, dirt on the walls and unclean bedlinnen, one of the people i was travelling with CAUGHT SCABIES from the sheets. the staff are rude, unhelpful and when we complained that we were being kept up unlit 6 in the morning bu the people in the room next to us they refused to help. dont let this s*it hole ruin amsterdam for you, find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: mags21s
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location! THAT IS IT!!!! My three friends and I got back on Saturday we have all had to go to the doctors today as we all developed a rash all over our bodies on our 3rd day, we have found out that it is Scabies!!! The doctor said we got it from the dirty beds at this hotel!!! Which was no surprise to be honest as the room was terrible! Its was very small, the toilet smelt disgusting the whole time we were there, you couldn't sit on the toilet because the sink was so close and you would hit your head on it!! No where to put your clothes, beds...... well what can I say extremley dirty!! Staff on reception very rude and unhelpful! Not allowed to take food or drink into the hotel! We would NEVER go to this hotel again after what we have got from the dirty beds!!! Room 305!!!! DO NOT GO!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hairs in my bed that were not mine!”
Reviews.Author: sf045
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, double ensuite room good size. No tea and coffee making facilities and we were not even allowed to bring in any food or drink( we hid bottles of water in the end.) Someone else's hair in the bed :( A safe but no combination code. Some staff were helpful but the girl at the breakfast area was not very friendly. Breakfast very basic. Dont think i would stay again. Fine if its just somewhere to put your head down at night. Quiet, so thats good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: EUHR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in very good position, just 5 minutes from the Leidsei squere. Rooms are clean, and the stuff are very nice and helpfull.Atmosfer is nice and frendly. I recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the Money”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fine central location (3 trams stop a block away) with shops and eateries and 'coffeeshops' all nearby. It's also near some gay places (hotels, bars, bookstore) if that's your thing. Though half block off a busy street, the hotel is quiet and safe. My room was terribly small (2 feet of floor space around the bed) but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean and updated. I don't live in my hotel room so room size isn't that important. Still, it's like a claustrophobic dorm room with a tiny bathroom. There's minimal space to store your clothes, so you just live out of your suitcase. BYO hangers, alarm clock and soap. There's also basic cable and a phone in the room. The complimentary breakfast buffet was so-so but there's good coffee, juice, bread and granola. The breakfast 'meats' were scary mystery cold cuts that I avoided. The front desk staff is the weakest aspect of the hotel. Half the time the staffer isn't at the desk and one of the staffers blew me off when i asked him how to use the in room safe, telling me they're not necessary, the hotel is secure. Another staffer was more helpful and I used the safe all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Garrulo
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel, located in the very centre of the city, near Leiden Square and close to the tram stop (1-2-5) that takes you in few minutes to central station. Staff friendly, thin walls, normal breakfast. Nobody came to change our tovels/sheets during our four days stay. 24 h reception. You konw, when you are in Amsterdam everything it's ok...

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: cearc
Reviews.Content: It is rare to find good Amsterdam lodging that is also affordable. That makes the Downtown Hotel a rare find. Will certainly look to stay here again next time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Hairy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Stayed one night. B&B 86euros inc local tax for which you get a very clean room with ensuite shower. Bed was very comfy and it had a flat screen TV. Single room was small but adequate-if all your doing is sleeping. Not a place to spend a lot of time in but if you sleep there and maybe have an afternoon rest before you hit the town its ok. Very close to Leidesplein and at the price I reckon its one of the better budget hotels - definitely use it again -.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: snowhiite
Reviews.Content: it's not expensive but comfortable and neat and it's located in the middle of every interesting spots

HotelInfo.Name: DownTown Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kerkstraat 25, Amsterdam 1017 GA, The Netherlands
